content.question: Two particles move in the xy-plane. For time t ≥ 0, the position of particle A is given by x = t − 2 and y = (t − 2)2, and the position of particle B is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C24@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C23@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find the velocity vector for each particle at time t = 3.

frqParts.text: Two particles move in the xy-plane. For time t ≥ 0, the position of particle A is given by x = t − 2 and y = (t − 2)2, and the position of particle B is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C24@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C23@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find the velocity vector for each particle at time t = 3.
(b) Set up an integral expression that gives the distance traveled by particle A from t = 0 to t = 3 . Do not evaluate.
(c) Determine the exact time at which the particles collide; that is, when the particles are at the same point at the same time. Justify your answer.
(d) In the viewing window provided below, sketch the paths of particles A and B from t = 0 until they collide. Indicate the direction of each particle along its path.

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
